turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Nothofagus solandri.
turn.1: What is the difference between the species Nothofagus solandri and other closely related species?
turn.3: What does the species look like?
turn.4: solandri, commonly called Black beech, is a variety of the tree species "Nothofagus solandri", endemic to New Zealand.
turn.6: Black beech occurs on both the North and the South Island at low altitudes up to the mountains.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The other variety of "N. solandri" is called Mountain beech or "Nothofagus solandri" var.
turn.9: What is the difference between the two?
turn.10: "cliffortioides", and grows at higher altitudes than black beech.
turn.11: What other closely related species are there?
turn.12: In New Zealand the taxon is called "Fuscospora solandri".
